bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WENSTRUP:H.J. Res. 27.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 17____________________[Page H473]

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 22 - 14.

bill.title: Disapproving the action of the District of Columbia Council in approving the Death with Dignity Act of 2016.

item.text: This joint resolution nullifies the action of the District of Columbia Council in approving the Death with Dignity Act of 2016, signed by the Mayor of the District on December 19, 2016, and transmitted on January 6, 2017, to Congress pursuant to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act. The D.C. Act authorizes terminally ill patients to request and to be prescribed medication to end their lives.
item.name: Introduced in House

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.latestTitle: A joint resolution disapproving the action of the District of Columbia Council in approving the Death with Dignity Act of 2016.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
